intro: Astracantha coarctata, commonly known as the narrow-lobed corymbiferous plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has a succulent, branching stem with narrow, fleshy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in corymbs, and bloom during the warmer months. Astracantha coarctata is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
